guicomponents
Class GTextField

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.GComponent
      guicomponents.GTextField
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants, java.lang.Comparable
public class GTextField
extends GComponent

The text field component.
This component can be created to manage either a single line of text or multiple lines of text.
If height of the component is too small to show a line of text because of the font size then it is increased.
Enables user text input at runtime. Text can be selected using the mouse or keyboard shortcuts and then copied or cut to the clipboard. Text can also be pasted in. It supports text that is longer than the displayable area

Author:
Brendan Nichols & Peter Lager

Parameters:

Method Detail

setFont

public void setFont(java.lang.String fontname,
                    int fontSize,
                    int fontLeading)
Set the font, size and leading for the textfield.
The height of the textfield will be increased if it is not possible to show a line of text due to the font size.

Parameters:
fontname -
fontSize -
fontLeading - line spacing

setFont

public void setFont(java.lang.String fontname,
                    int fontsize)
Set the font type and size for the textfield.
The height of the textfield will be increased if it is not possible to show a line of text due to the font size. Use the existing line spacing value (textLeading).

Overrides:
setFont in class GComponent
Parameters:
fontname -
fontsize -
